skill.name: commit-prepare
skill.description: Prepare git commit messages following conventional commits. Activates on: commit, prepare commit, commit this, commit message, ready to commit, stage and commit
skill.summary: Prepare git commit messages following conventional commits. Activates on: commit, prepare commit, co...
skill.author: ByronWilliamsCPA

security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based skill consisting only of markdown documentation. It provides workflow guidance for preparing conventional git commit messages. No executable code, no network operations, no file access beyond standard git commands which align with the stated purpose.

content.value_statement: Writing clear, standardized commit messages improves code review and project maintainability. This skill analyzes your staged changes and generates properly formatted conventional commit messages with correct type prefixes, scopes, and descriptions.
actual_capabilities: Analyzes staged and unstaged git changes to understand modifications
Determines commit type (feat, fix, docs, refactor, test, chore, perf, ci)
Generates conventional commit messages with proper format and structure
Handles breaking changes with proper footer notation
Detects when changes should be split into multiple commits
Executes git add and commit commands with proper heredoc formatting
limitations: Does not automatically push commits to remote repositories
Does not modify commit history after push without explicit user request
Does not validate that commit messages follow project-specific rules
Cannot access commit history from other team members for context

use_cases.title: Streamline Personal Workflow
use_cases.description: Quickly generate consistent commit messages without memorizing conventional commit types and formats

use_cases.title: Meet Project Standards
use_cases.description: Ensure contributions follow project conventions for easier review and acceptance of pull requests

use_cases.title: Enforce Commit Discipline
use_cases.description: Maintain consistent commit history across team members for better changelog generation and debugging

prompt_templates.title: Breaking Change
prompt_templates.prompt: ready to commit with breaking changes

output: Generated commit: feat(auth): add OAuth token refresh
Body: Implement automatic token refresh when access token expires
Includes retry logic with exponential backoff
Ready to commit? Say yes to execute.

best_practices: Review the generated commit message before confirming to ensure accuracy
Use the body section to explain why the change was made, not just what changed
Split unrelated changes into separate commits for cleaner history
anti_patterns: Using generic messages like 'fix bug' or 'update code' without specifics
Skipping the body when changes are complex or non-obvious
Committing large binary files without considering repository size impact

faq.question: What platforms support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Claude Code, and OpenAI Codex when connected to git repositories.

faq.question: What is the character limit for commit subjects?
faq.answer: Conventional commits recommend 50 characters or less for the subject line without a trailing period.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with GitHub Copilot?
faq.answer: This skill is designed for CLI-based AI tools. GitHub Copilot has separate git integration features.

faq.question: Is my commit data stored or transmitted?
faq.answer: No. This skill runs locally using git commands. Commit data stays on your machine.

faq.question: Why did my commit fail with pre-commit hooks?
faq.answer: The skill does not bypass hooks by default. Check your pre-commit configuration for failures.

faq.question: How is this different from git commit templates?
faq.answer: This skill actively analyzes your changes and suggests messages. Templates are passive reminders you fill manually.
